|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |                                                      |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | [monst.c#line1292](/wiki/Monst.c#line1292 "Monst.c") |

A **lichen**, F, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The lichen is a type of [fungus](/wiki/Fungus "Fungus") that is one of the earliest monsters the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") can encounter.

A lichen has a [sticky](/wiki/Sticky "Sticky") touch attack that deals no damage, but holds the hero in place for a short amount of time, and has no effect on monsters.

Lichen [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") do not become tainted or rot away from age, though they can become too old to [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") as with corpses. Dipping a lichen corpse into a [potion of acid](/wiki/Potion_of_acid "Potion of acid") causes the corpse to "turn red around the edges" (or orange if the potion is diluted) without using up the potion.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

A "master lichen", whose name is a portmanteau of the lichen and [master lich](/wiki/Master_lich "Master lich"), is one of the [hallucinatory monsters](/wiki/Hallucinatory_monster "Hallucinatory monster") that can be seen while [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [5.4 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated lichens are always hostile.

## Strategy

Lichen are extremely slow, moving at the minimum [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") of 1, and the worst they can do with their sticky attack is prevent the hero from attacking other hostile targets - even then, this scenario is rare and lichens can be easily killed by almost any starting hero.

Lichen corpses can be carried indefinitely as normal [comestibles](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") which are always safe to [eat](/wiki/Eat "Eat"): they provide 200 nutrition, but weigh the same as a [food ration](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration"), so they should ideally be eaten first to free up carrying capacity - [vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian") and [vegan](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct") heroes will usually prioritize collecting lichen corpses early on. Lichen corpses can also be used to tame [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") [herbivores](/wiki/Herbivore "Herbivore") such as [ponies](/wiki/Ponies "Ponies"), pacify domestic [carnivores](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore") and feed herbivorous or omnivorous [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet").

## History

The lichen first appears in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

The messages produced when a lichen corpse is dipped in a potion of acid are introduced in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Lichen](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lichen "wikipedia:Lichen")***

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Edible lichen](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edible_lichen "wikipedia:Edible lichen")***

Lichen are composite organisms that arise from algae or cyanobacteria living among filaments of multiple fungi species. Lichens can occur in many environmental conditions, including several extreme ones, and can grow on almost any surfac—they also have a history of being used as food, hence the properties of their corpses in *NetHack*. The interaction between lichen corpses and acid are also based on real-life [litmus](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/litmus "wikipedia:litmus") tests, which use \dyes extracted from lichens as a pH indicator.

## Variants

The [arch-lichen](/wiki/Arch-lichen "Arch-lichen") [patch](/wiki/Patch "Patch") by Nodey for [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") adds the titular monster, which is an extremely powerful type of lichen.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the lichen is the only fungus or mold that will not [revive](/wiki/Revive "Revive") from its corpse.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

A lichen has an overall 1.85% chance of generating from a corpse that reach 51 turns of age, is not [acidic](/wiki/Acidic "Acidic"), and is not located within or on top of a square of [water](/wiki/Water "Water"), [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice") or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) This makes it possible to 'farm' corpses for lichen early in the game, though it can somewhat impractical, and certain corpses are better off eaten while they are still fresh.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), lichens are given an additional touch attack that temporarily [slows](/wiki/Slow "Slow") its target, and both of its touch attacks can inflict minor damage.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), lichens are slightly less likely to generate from old corpses due to the addition of some new fungi and molds. All other SLASH'EM details apply.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), lichens behave as they do in EvilHack, and can grow from corpses as in SLASH'EM, though corpses will become mold-infested less often.

## Encyclopedia entry

The chamber was of unhewn rock, round, as near as might  
be, eighteen or twenty feet across, and gay with rich  
variety of fern and moss and lichen. The fern was in  
its winter still, or coiling for the spring-tide; but  
moss was in abundant life, some feathering, and some  
gobleted, and some with fringe of red to it.

\[ Lorna Doone, by R.D. Blackmore ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2094](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/potion.c#L2094)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [mkobj.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 764](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/mkobj.c#line764 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/mkobj.c")
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [mkobj.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 765](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/mkobj.c#line765 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/mkobj.c")
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [do.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1685](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/do.c#line1685 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/do.c")
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [mkobj.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 811](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/mkobj.c#line811 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/mkobj.c")
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [do.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1680](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/do.c#line1680 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/do.c")

F lichen
Difficulty 1
Attacks

Touch 0d0 sticky

Base level 0
Base experience 4
Speed 1
Base AC 9
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 4 (Uncommon)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 20
Nutritional value 200
Size Small
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A lichen:

  • does not breathe.
  • cannot pick up items.
  • has no eyes.
  • has no limbs.
  • has no head.
  • is mindless.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
Reference monst.c#line1292

A lichen, F, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. The lichen is a type of fungus that is one of the earliest monsters the hero can encounter.

A lichen has a sticky touch attack that deals no damage, but holds the hero in place for a short amount of time, and has no effect on monsters.

Lichen corpses do not become tainted or rot away from age, though they can become too old to sacrifice as with corpses. Dipping a lichen corpse into a potion of acid causes the corpse to "turn red around the edges" (or orange if the potion is diluted) without using up the potion.[1]

A "master lichen", whose name is a portmanteau of the lichen and master lich, is one of the hallucinatory monsters that can be seen while hallucinating.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Origin
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 EvilHack
    • 5.3 SlashTHEM
    • 5.4 Hack'EM
  • 6 Encyclopedia entry
  • 7 References

Generation

Randomly generated lichens are always hostile.

Strategy

Lichen are extremely slow, moving at the minimum speed of 1, and the worst they can do with their sticky attack is prevent the hero from attacking other hostile targets - even then, this scenario is rare and lichens can be easily killed by almost any starting hero.

Lichen corpses can be carried indefinitely as normal comestibles which are always safe to eat: they provide 200 nutrition, but weigh the same as a food ration, so they should ideally be eaten first to free up carrying capacity - vegetarian and vegan conduct heroes will usually prioritize collecting lichen corpses early on. Lichen corpses can also be used to tame domestic herbivores such as ponies, pacify domestic carnivores and feed herbivorous or omnivorous pets.

History

The lichen first appears in NetHack 3.3.0.

The messages produced when a lichen corpse is dipped in a potion of acid are introduced in NetHack 3.6.0.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Lichen
Wikipedia has an article about:
Edible lichen

Lichen are composite organisms that arise from algae or cyanobacteria living among filaments of multiple fungi species. Lichens can occur in many environmental conditions, including several extreme ones, and can grow on almost any surfac—they also have a history of being used as food, hence the properties of their corpses in NetHack. The interaction between lichen corpses and acid are also based on real-life litmus tests, which use \dyes extracted from lichens as a pH indicator.

Variants

The arch-lichen patch by Nodey for NetHack 3.4.3 adds the titular monster, which is an extremely powerful type of lichen.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, the lichen is the only fungus or mold that will not revive from its corpse.[2]

A lichen has an overall 1.85% chance of generating from a corpse that reach 51 turns of age, is not acidic, and is not located within or on top of a square of water, ice or lava.[3][4][5][6] This makes it possible to 'farm' corpses for lichen early in the game, though it can somewhat impractical, and certain corpses are better off eaten while they are still fresh.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, lichens are given an additional touch attack that temporarily slows its target, and both of its touch attacks can inflict minor damage.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, lichens are slightly less likely to generate from old corpses due to the addition of some new fungi and molds. All other SLASH'EM details apply.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, lichens behave as they do in EvilHack, and can grow from corpses as in SLASH'EM, though corpses will become mold-infested less often.

Encyclopedia entry

The chamber was of unhewn rock, round, as near as might
be, eighteen or twenty feet across, and gay with rich
variety of fern and moss and lichen. The fern was in
its winter still, or coiling for the spring-tide; but
moss was in abundant life, some feathering, and some
gobleted, and some with fringe of red to it.

[ Lorna Doone, by R.D. Blackmore ]

A '''lichen''', {{monsym|lichen}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. The lichen is a type of [[fungus]] that is one of the earliest monsters the [[hero]] can encounter.

A lichen has a [[sticky]] touch attack that deals no damage, but holds the hero in place for a short amount of time, and has no effect on monsters.

Lichen [[corpse]]s do not become tainted or rot away from age, though they can become too old to [[sacrifice]] as with corpses. Dipping a lichen corpse into a [[potion of acid]] causes the corpse to "turn red around the edges" (or orange if the potion is diluted) without using up the potion.{{refsrc|src/potion.c|2094|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

A "master lichen", whose name is a portmanteau of the lichen and [[master lich]], is one of the [[hallucinatory monster]]s that can be seen while [[hallucinating]].

==Generation==
Randomly generated lichens are always hostile.

==Strategy==
Lichen are extremely slow, moving at the minimum [[speed]] of 1, and the worst they can do with their sticky attack is prevent the hero from attacking other hostile targets - even then, this scenario is rare and lichens can be easily killed by almost any starting hero.

Lichen corpses can be carried indefinitely as normal [[comestible]]s which are always safe to [[eat]]: they provide 200 nutrition, but weigh the same as a [[food ration]], so they should ideally be eaten first to free up carrying capacity - [[vegetarian]] and [[vegan]] [[conduct]] heroes will usually prioritize collecting lichen corpses early on. Lichen corpses can also be used to tame [[domestic]] [[herbivore]]s such as [[ponies]], pacify domestic [[carnivore]]s and feed herbivorous or omnivorous [[pet]]s.

==History==
The lichen first appears in [[NetHack 3.3.0]].

The messages produced when a lichen corpse is dipped in a potion of acid are introduced in [[NetHack 3.6.0]].

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Lichen}}
{{wikipedia|Edible lichen}}
Lichen are composite organisms that arise from algae or cyanobacteria living among filaments of multiple fungi species. Lichens can occur in many environmental conditions, including several extreme ones, and can grow on almost any surfac—they also have a history of being used as food, hence the properties of their corpses in ''NetHack''. The interaction between lichen corpses and acid are also based on real-life [[wikipedia:litmus|litmus]] tests, which use \dyes extracted from lichens as a pH indicator.

==Variants==
The [[arch-lichen]] [[patch]] by Nodey for [[NetHack 3.4.3]] adds the titular monster, which is an extremely powerful type of lichen.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], the lichen is the only fungus or mold that will not [[revive]] from its corpse.{{refsrc|mkobj.c|764|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

A lichen has an overall 1.85% chance of generating from a corpse that reach 51 turns of age, is not [[acidic]], and is not located within or on top of a square of [[water]], [[ice]] or [[lava]].{{refsrc|mkobj.c|765|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|do.c|1685|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|mkobj.c|811|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|do.c|1680|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} This makes it possible to 'farm' corpses for lichen early in the game, though it can somewhat impractical, and certain corpses are better off eaten while they are still fresh.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], lichens are given an additional touch attack that temporarily [[slow]]s its target, and both of its touch attacks can inflict minor damage.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], lichens are slightly less likely to generate from old corpses due to the addition of some new fungi and molds. All other SLASH'EM details apply.

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], lichens behave as they do in EvilHack, and can grow from corpses as in SLASH'EM, though corpses will become mold-infested less often.

==Encyclopedia entry==

The chamber was of unhewn rock, round, as near as might
be, eighteen or twenty feet across, and gay with rich
variety of fern and moss and lichen.  The fern was in
its winter still, or coiling for the spring-tide; but
moss was in abundant life, some feathering, and some
